intro: Melhania sidoides, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsules as its fruit. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The flowers emit a sweet fragrance, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
